text: [Music]
welcome to this episode of AWS
QuickStart series
on building your web application on AWS
my name is Artie and I'm a Solutions
Architect with Amazon Web Services today
I'll be walking you through the steps to
set up your first WordPress application
using Amazon light Co now WordPress is
an open source software which is very
popular to build blogging websites it's
based on PHP and my sequel you can also
use WordPress to build other
applications and websites Amazon light
Co is a Wachtel private server offering
this was primarily designed to make it
very easy for you to get your workloads
up and running you do not need any
background expertise on running or
managing infrastructure on AWS there are
a few unique characteristics of Amazon
lightsail that sets it apart from other
AWS services let's look at what those
are the first light think it was a
bundled offering what this means is when
you sign up for a light sale plan it
comes with a package that includes
compute storage and networking further
each of these components are fully
pre-configured for you next your Amazon
lights your package starts with fixed
price starting from $3.50 for UNIX and
Linux based operating systems and $8 a
month for Windows what this means is it
makes it extremely easy for you to
predict your bill at the end of each
month
now light sale comes with its own
console that is designed to make it an
extremely intuitive for you to get your
first application I've been running also
designed to be simple you still have the
ability to grow and build complex
workloads using light sale for example
you can provision additional storage for
your light zero instances or you could
setup load balancing and distribute your
traffic across multiple like zero
instances light Z also integrates nicely
with other a double yourself
so you could choose to host your website
on light sail but host your relational
database using I mean Amazon relational
database service or RDS now for those of
you in the audience who prefer
programmatic access you can use the API
or the command-line interface so with
that let's now look at a demo of how
exactly you would go about setting up
your WordPress application or needham
using lightsail there are three key
steps to this the first you would log
into your lightsail console the second
will use a pre-built WordPress blueprint
to spin up the application and finally
once your application is up you will see
how you can log into it and want it to
read we see here that we are logged in
into a lightsail console let's click on
create instance next you will see that
our region has defaulted to Singapore in
this case however lightsail is available
across many different regions in the
world we will stick with Singapore for
this one the next setting you see here
is an availability zone available
razones or ACS are isolated locations
within an AWS region you can choose to
distribute your resources across ACS and
design your applications are set of one
resource goes down the other one can
take on the load so essentially they
allow you to design a highly available
infrastructure if you now scroll down
you can select your operating system you
have two choices here the first is Linux
or UNIX based operating systems and the
other is Windows for this demo we will
stick with the Linux operating system
now blueprints are lightsail come with
pre-configured applications installed on
your operating system however you do
have the option to start with the base
OS image and then install the
application of your choice on this for
this demo again we will be using the
WordPress blueprint
next if you scroll down you will see
that you have the ability to customize
your instance as it comes up by
specifying additional launch scripts in
this case since we have picked a Linux
instance light sea also provides you
with an SSH key which you can use to
connect directly to your instance you
see that it has set up a default key for
you you can download this key and use it
later to SSH into your instance from
your computers the next is the instance
plan you see here the plans start with
$5 but since this video was recorded
today the fares are starting from $3.50
onwards the last thing is to give your
instance a friendly name and in this
case we will be spending up just one
copy of our WordPress server we click on
create once we do this we should now see
our WordPress show up in our dashboard
with the status of pending so let's take
a quick look at the other terms light
zeal allows you to attach a fixed public
IP to your instance when you do not have
a static IP every time your light 0
instance reboots it'll come up with a
new public IP however static IP space
restarts also if you're building a
public facing website you likely want to
bring your own domain name so we provide
basic domain name management
capabilities and Amazon light sale and
finally you can also configure a load
balancer to distribute your traffic
across multiple light 0 instances this
is a great way to make your architecture
highly available in fault-tolerant
but the pub for the purposes of this
demo we will not be using one next under
the storage tab you can provision
additional storage for your lights a or
instances by clicking on create a disk
so just make sure that you choose the
same region for your disk as you did for
your WordPress instance which is
Singapore in this case you have a choice
starting from 8gb all the way up to 16
terabytes now if you scroll down you can
give your disk a custom name for this
demo will not be provisioning any
additional discs finally snapshots now
snapshots are point-in-time images of
your like zero instances and they are a
great way to build your disaster
recovery strategy so you can use
snapshots to create new light zero
instances so now let's go back to our
instances tab and you should see here
that our instance has come up and
running come up to a running status now
so what we'll do next is look at the
details of this WordPress instance the
first tab you see here has connection
details you have two different ways to
connect to your light zero instance one
you can directly SSH into the instance
you can do this from your computer using
the default key that we downloaded
earlier or you can use the public IP
address to directly access the front end
of your WordPress application so let's
copy this IP address into a new browser
and you should see that this loads up
the default blogging web page now let's
go back and explore the SSH option now
lightsail allows us SH directly from
your browser into the machine which is a
very useful feature you can see that
when I click on this button it takes me
to the terminal of my WordPress instance
and I can type in my Linux commands here
for example I can list the contents of
the directory on the right-hand bottom
you will see a clipboard icon which
makes it very easy for you to copy
instructions from your local computer in
this case
to the Instituto WordPress instance
however note that the reverse is also
possible you can copy contents from here
to your local computer now let's take a
quick look at the metrics tab here
metrics are a nice way to monitor the
health of your WordPress instance you
can see here but this shows you metrics
I CPU utilization the data transfer in
and out of your instance and also the
overall health of your instance if you
scroll up you have the option to change
the time period for the metrics and the
graphs will update themselves
finally the history tab which will you
show you all actions that you have
performed on your instance for example
if I create additional storage that
action will show up here under history
at the very top you can use the stop and
reboot buttons to stop or restart your
instance and that concludes the demo as
the next steps I would encourage you to
visit the lightsail console at
aws.amazon.com slash lightsail and
explore the different features that like
Zeo has to offer you can use Amazon Lite
sales free tier for a period of one
month to build your own e-commerce
website so blog sites or even your test
environments apart from that it obvious
also offers you a generous free tier for
the first 12 months if you're someone
who are aspiring to create your own
startup you can benefit from the AWS
activate program which gives you access
to free credits and training resources
you can learn more about this program by
visiting aws.amazon.com slash activate
and with that I'd like to thank you for
watching
